snippet: The Federal Reserve reported that American households’ net worth, before inflation, had surpassed the level in 2007.
abstract: Federal Reserve reports that household net worth jumped by just over $3 trillion, or 4.5 percent, to $70.3 trillion in first quarter of 2013, surpassing 2007 levels; encouraging report comes amid other signs of improving economy, including positive housing sector and soaring stock market.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve reported that American households’ net worth, before inflation, had surpassed the level in 2007.

headline.seo: U.S. Households’ Finances Regain Lost Ground
headline.main: Fed Reports American Households Have Regained Ground Lost in the Recession
headline.print_headline: Fed Reports American Households Have Regained Ground Lost in the Recession
